wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Paget (1799 – August 1873) was a British politician.
Paget came from an old Leicestershire family. He represented Nottingham as a Liberal from 1856 (on the promotion of the former MP to Lord Belper) to 1865. He lived at the grange in Ruddington, five miles from Nottingham, which he built in 1828.He had six children by his first wife, Eliza, who died in 1834.  He and his second wife were drowned by a freak wave at Filey.
